explanation: Agent A is correct. The code calls strlen(session->value_1) and strlen(session->value_2) without any local checks that those pointers are non-NULL and point to NUL-terminated character arrays. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 requires that uses of the <string.h> functions must not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters; calling strlen on a NULL pointer or on a non‑NUL‑terminated buffer can read out of bounds (or dereference NULL) and therefore violates the rule unless there is a proven externally enforced invariant. No such invariant is visible in the snippet, so the report of a violation is justified. (SECOND_PAGE as a literal is safe.)
